quotes.quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
Every citizen of India must remember that... he is an Indian and he has every right in this country but with certain... duties
Who lives if India dies?
A 'No' uttered from deepest conviction is better than a 'Yes' merely uttered to please, or worse, to avoid trouble
We want deeper sincerity of motive, a greater courage in speech and earnestness in action.
In attaining our ideals, our means should be as pure as the end.
Don't see others doing better than you, beat your own records every day, because success is a fight between you and yourself.
Life itself is your teacher, and you are in a state of constant learning.
Better remain silent, better not even think, if you are not prepared to act.
So long as you do not achieve social liberty, whatever freedom is provided by the law is of no avail to you.
If things go wrong under the new Constitution, the reason will not be that we had a bad Constitution. What we will have to say is that Man was vile
Citizenshp consists in the service of the country.
Constitution is not a mere lawyers document, it is a vehicle of life, and its spirit is always the spirit of age.
Nations consist of people. And with their effort, a nation can accomplish all it could ever want.
Despise school and remain a fool.
This elegant generalization is mathematically very appealing; but physics means facing facts. You should take up case by case.
One result of unimaginative, mechanistic thinking was that societies eventually ceased to burn people at the stake for witchcraft.
The face of Nature as presented to us is infinitely varied, but to those who love her it is ever beautiful and interesting.
No real change in history has ever been achieved by discussions.
Either I will come back after hoisting the tricolour, or I will come back wrapped in it, but I will be back for sure.
If a man says he is not afraid of dying, he is either lying or is a Gurkha.
Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
One individual may die for an idea, but that idea will, after his death, incarnate itself in a thousand lives
I regret I have but one life to give for my country.
The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
You have never lived until you have almost died, and for those who choose to fight, Life has a special flavour, the protected will never know.
Some goals are so worthy, it’s glorious even to fail.
We fight to win and win with a knockout because there are no runners-up in war.
People learn more on their own rather than being force fed.
You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.
Those who are prepared to die for any cause are seldom defeated.
A war based on Satyagraha is always of two kinds. One is the war we wage against injustice and the other we fight against our own weaknesses.
Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action-Into that heaven of freedom, my father, let my country awake.
If a seed of a lettuce will not grow, we do not blame the lettuce. Instead, the fault lies with us for not having nourished the seed properly.
Even if I died in the service of the nation, I would be proud of it. Every drop of my blood… will contribute to the growth of this nation and to make it strong and dynamic.
The school is the last expenditure upon which America should be willing to economize.
I believe that education is all about being excited about something. Seeing passion and enthusiasm helps push an educational message.
Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Revolution is an inalienable right of mankind. Freedom is an imperishable birthright of all.
A rebellion is not a revolution. It may ultimately lead to that end.
Merciless criticism and independent thinking are the two necessary traits of revolutionary thinking.
Don’t take rest after your first victory because if you fail in second, more lips are waiting to say that your first victory was just luck.
I believe in a religion that propagates freedom, equality and brotherhood.
Don’t see others doing better than you, beat your own records every day because success is a fight between you and yourself.
A plane is always safe on the ground, but it is not made for that. Always take some meaningful risks in life to achieve great heights.
We want deeper sincerity of motive, a greater courage in speech and earnestness in action.
A country’s greatness lies in its undying ideals of love and sacrifice that inspire the mothers of the race.
Bombs and pistols do not make a revolution. The sword of revolution is sharpened on the whetting-stone of ideas.
We will face the bullets of the enemies; we are free and will remain free.
Life is all about a card game. Choosing the right cards is not in our hand. But playing well with the cards in hand determines our success.
One individual may die for an idea, but that idea will, after his death, incarnate itself in a thousand lives.
Freedom is not given, it is taken.
Men, money and material cannot by themselves bring victory or freedom. We must have the motive-power that will inspire us to brave deeds and heroic exploits.
Life loses half its interest if there is no struggle — if there are no risks to be taken.
Life should be great rather than long.
The policy of being too cautious is the greatest risk of all.
Ignorance is always afraid of change.
All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.
Political tyranny is nothing compared to social tyranny and a reformer who defies society is a more courageous man than a politician who defies government.
The tree laden with fruits always bends low. If you wish to be great, be lowly and meek.
Democracy is good. I say this because other systems are worse.
We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
Prophet Mohammed would have no objection to The Satanic Verses.
Arise, Awake and Stop not until the goal is reached.
I am not very good at statistics. I am also a poor thinker.
You must be the change you want to see in the world.
Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
Failure comes only when we forget our ideals and objectives and principles.
I am an Indian. In fact, I feel like a foreigner when I go abroad.
You must learn to be still in the midst of activity and to be vibrantly alive in repose.
A politician should not be written off till he or she is cremated.
There is an important distinction between barriers to entry and barriers to imitation.
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
To succeed in your mission, you must have single-minded devotion to your goal.
No apology is necessary for being truthful to the echoes of one’s mother tongue.
Do not say, ‘It is morning,’ and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.
The biggest problem in the world today is not poverty or disease but the lack of love and charity and the feeling of being unwanted.
No religion has mandated killing others as a requirement for its sustenance or promotion.
They cannot stop me. I will get my education, if it is in the home, school, or anyplace.
After all, our Killers are our …Brothers!!??
Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in.
The sword of revolution is sharpened on the whetting stone of ideas.
No girl has offered to go to bed with me in return for a part (in a film). I wish it would happen.
Education is the manifestation of perfection already in a man.
Did Indira Gandhi ask for somebody’s permission to carry out the test in 1974?
The mullahs of the Islamic world and the mullahs of the Hindu world and the mullahs of the Christian world are all on the same side. And we are against them all.
One must beware of ministers who can do nothing without money, and those who want to do everything with money.
The Congress has made this country. The rest (the opposition parties) are all tenants.
Even if we lose the wealth of thousands, and our life is sacrificed, we…should keep smiling and be cheerful keeping our faith in God and Truth.
The world is not impermanent if one lives there after knowing God.
No real change in history has ever been achieved by discussions.
The aim of life is no more to control the mind, but to develop it harmoniously; not to achieve salvation here after, but to make the best use of it here below.
I believe the country needs a dictatorship.
Another world is not only possible, she is on her way. On a quiet day, I can hear her breathing.
We will build neither mandirs nor masjids. Our priority will be to build latrines.
Soldiers who always remain faithful to their nation, who are always prepared to sacrifice their lives, are invincible.
Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.

Have you ever been at sea in a dense fog, when it seemed as if a tangible white darkness shut you in and the great ship, tense and anxious, groped her way toward the shore with plummet and sounding-line, and you waited with beating heart for something to happen? I was like that ship before my education began, only I was without compass or sounding line, and no way of knowing how near the harbor was. “Light! Give me light!” was the wordless cry of my soul, and the light of love shone on me in that very hour.

Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
[Kids] don’t remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are.
Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
We spend the first year of a child’s life teaching it to walk and talk and the rest of its life to shut up and sit down. There’s something wrong there.
Do not confine your children to your own learning, for they were born in another time.
Wisdom…. comes not from age, but from education and learning.
Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.
We realize the importance of our voices only when we are silenced.

Education is very important. The more education a woman has the more she is looked down upon. Nothing comes easy for a woman, and that is why she is tough. She has to earn everything she works hard for—that’s fine, and honestly, it isn’t an issue. Hard work grooms a woman to be a powerful force.
No country can ever truly flourish if it stifles the potential of its women and deprives itself of the contributions of half of its citizens.
You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation.
I raise up my voice-not so I can shout but so that those without a voice can be heard…we cannot succeed when half of us are held back.

If you are in a country that is progressive, the woman is progressive. If you’re in a country that reflects the consciousness toward the importance of education, it’s because the woman is aware of the importance of education. But in every backward country you’ll find the women are backward, and in every country where education is not stressed its because the women don’t have education.
We need women who are so strong they can be gentle, so educated they can be humble, so fierce they can be compassionate, so passionate they can be rational, and so disciplined they can be free.
Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind.
Education can never stop! “The more we read, the more we learn. The more we learn, the fuller life seems.
quotes.quote_by: L.M Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

quotes.quote: If girls and women have good education and opportunities to go on in life, they can help to break down the walls of envy and misunderstanding, to give new meaning to culture and history, to establish a sense of personal security for individual men and women, not just a collective security that crushes individuality.
I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.
Read at every wait; read at all hours; read within leisure; read in times of labor; read as one goes in; read as one goes out. The task of the educated mind is simply put: read to lead.
A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies. The man who never reads lives only one.
The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.
If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales.
Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you’ll go.
Nurture your mind with great thoughts, for you will never go any higher than you think.
Reading is the key that unlocks the door of creativity.
Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Education is a right, not a privilege; it is an opportunity, not an entitlement.
Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.
Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
Education without values, as useful as it is, seems rather to make man a more clever devil.
Prejudices, it is well known, are most difficult to eradicate from the heart whose soil has never been loosened or fertilised by education: they grow there, firm as weeds among stones.
Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
The purpose of a good education is to show you that there are three sides to a two-sided story.
Give a bowl of rice to a man and you will feed him for a day. Teach him how to grow his own rice and you will save his life.
It’s a universal law– intolerance is the first sign of an inadequate education. An ill-educated person behaves with arrogant impatience, whereas truly profound education breeds humility.
If you think education is expensive, try ignorance.
Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
The question is not how will you work if you lose your job; the question is how will you find one if you don’t have an education?
I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
We are all born with genius, but most of us are squelched, either by our parents, our teachers, our society. We go to great schools but they do not teach us the thing we need to know: how to live.
Education is not the filling of a pail, it is the lighting of a fire.
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better.
Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.
Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in.
Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.
Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
The most important single ingredient in any successful educational system is . . . good teachers.
Often, it’s not about becoming a new person, but becoming the person you were meant to be, and already are, but don’t know how to be.
I don’t want to believe. I want to know.
Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned.
The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
The only person who is educated is the one who has learned how to learn …and change.

Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life. Remember that fear always lurks behind perfectionism.
We learn more by looking for the answer to a question and not finding it than we do from learning the answer itself.
Don’t let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
You will either step forward into growth, or you will step backward into safety.
When you teach another person, you don’t teach them the subject that is in your head. You instead teach them how to think.
Education brings great changes in the lives of those who strive the most.
For teachers, knowledge is not a fixed commodity that can be easily transmitted by rote. It is a fluid, complex, and interactive process of exchange.
The Best way to predict your Future is to create it.
Education costs money, but then so does ignorance.
Learning is not attained by chance; it must be sought for with ardour and diligence.
He, who opens a school door, closes a prison.
Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them become what they are capable of becoming.
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement; nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
Children have to be educated, but they have also to be left to educate themselves.
We should not teach children the sciences but give them a taste for them.
If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.

Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life. Remember that fear always lurks behind perfectionism.
People learn something every day, and a lot of times it’s that what they learned the day before was wrong.
Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere.
Education is what survives when what has been learned has been forgotten.
Learning is not attained by chance; it must be sought for with ardour and attended to with diligence.
Learning never exhausts the mind. The learning process is different for each individual. Hear these great thinkers muse on what learning means to them in these inspirational quotes.
Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow.
No matter how he may think himself accomplished, when he sets out to learn a new language, science or the bicycle, he has entered a new realm as truly as if he were a child newly born into the world.
I would like to learn, or remember, how to live.
The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be ignited.
I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.
The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you.
If the Romans had been obliged to learn Latin, they would never have found time to conquer the world.
Whoever ceases to be a student has never been a student.
The only real failure in life is one not learned from.
Whoso neglects learning in his youth, loses the past and is dead for the future.
I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
Learning without thought is a labor lost, thought without learning is perilous.
All of the top achievers I know are life-long learners. Looking for new skills, insights, and ideas. If they’re not learning, they’re not growing and not moving toward excellence.
All things good to know are difficult to learn.
We learn more by looking for the answer to a question and not finding it than we do from learning the answer itself.

Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.
Man’s mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.
You learn something every day if you pay attention.
Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every conceived notion, follow humbly wherever and whatever abysses nature leads, or you will learn nothing.
There are many things which we can afford to forget which it is yet well to learn.
Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before.
You have learned something. That always feels at first as if you had lost something.
Every act of conscious learning requires the willingness to suffer an injury to one’s self-esteem. That is why young children before they are aware of their own self-importance, learn so easily.
People learn something every day, and a lot of times it’s that what they learned the day before was wrong.
Always do what you are afraid to do.
Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty.      Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
A turtle makes progress when it sticks its neck out.

Believe in yourself, be strong, never give up no matter what the circumstances are. You are a champion and will overcome the dreaded obstacles. Champions take failure as a learning opportunity, so take in all you can, and run with it. Be your best and don't ever ever give up.
Cherish your visions and your dreams, as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements
Did you know that the Chinese symbol for 'crisis' includes a symbol which means 'opportunity'?
Don’t learn to do, but learn in doing. Let your falls not be on a prepared ground, but let them be bona fide falls in the rough and tumble of the world
Every artist was at first an amateur.
I hear, and I forget. I see, and I remember. I do, and I understand.
If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got.
If you find yourself saying 'But I can't speak English...', try adding the word '...yet'
If what you're doing isn't working, try something else!
If you think education is expensive, try ignorance.
If you know what you want, you are more likely to get it.
It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and made things happen.
It's not just about looking and copying, it's about feeling too.

It's ok to try things out, to ask questions, to feel unsure, to let your mind wander, to daydream, to ask for help, to experiment, to take time out, not to know, to practise, to ask for help again - and again, to make mistakes, to check your understanding.
Learning is never done without errors and defeat.
Nothing we ever imagined is beyond our powers, only beyond our present self-knowledge.
One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great      surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he could not do.
One must have strategies to execute dreams.
One must learn by doing the thing; for though you think you know it, you have no certainty, until you try.
People learn more quickly by doing something or seeing something done.
The important thing in life is not the triumph but the struggle.
Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself.
Too much credit is given to the end result. The true lesson is in the struggle that takes place between the dream and reality. That struggle is a thing called life!
The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
The only dreams impossible to reach are the ones you never pursue.
There two types of people; the can do and the can't. Which are you?
Whenever you feel like saying 'Yes, but....`, try saying instead 'Yes, and....'
Whether you think you can, or think you can't...you're right!
Worry is a misuse of the imagination.
A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
A liberal education is at the heart of a civil society, and at the heart of a liberal education is the act of teaching.

Ideal teachers are those who use themselves as bridges over which they invite their students to cross, then having facilitated their crossing, joyfully collapse, encouraging them to create bridges of their own.
Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths pure theatre.
Learning is finding out what we already know. Doing is demonstrating that you know it. Teaching is reminding others that they know just as well as you. You are all learners, doers, and teachers.
Much education today is monumentally ineffective. All too often we are giving young people cut flowers when we should be teaching them to grow their own plants.

A teacher who can arouse a feeling for one single good action, for one single good poem, accomplishes more than he who fills our memory with rows and rows of natural objects, classified with name and form.
I like a teacher who gives you something to take home to think about besides homework.

Thought flows in terms of stories — stories about events, stories about people, and stories about intentions and achievements. The best teachers are the best storytellers. We learn in the form of stories.
Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately, it kills all its pupils.
Once children learn how to learn, nothing is going to narrow their minds. The essence of teaching is to make learning contagious, to have one idea spark another.
Good teachers are those who know how little they know. Bad teachers are those who think they know more than they don't know.
A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on cold iron.
Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterward.
They may forget what you said but they will never forget how you made them feel.
Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself.
If a seed of a lettuce will not grow, we do not blame the lettuce. Instead, the fault lies with us for not having nourished the seed properly.
Good teaching is more a giving of right questions than a giving of right answers.
Every truth has four corners: as a teacher, I give you one corner, and it is for you to find the other three.
The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.

Do not train children to learn by force and harshness, but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
A good teacher must be able to put himself in the place of those who find learning hard.
The greatest sign of success for a teacher…is to be able to say, The children are now working as if I did not exist.

If a child is to keep alive his inborn sense of wonder, he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it, rediscovering with him the joy, the excitement, and the mystery of the world we live in.
It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
Awaken people's curiosity. It is enough to open minds, do not overload them. Put there just a spark.
A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
A teacher is one who makes himself progressively unnecessary.
A teacher who is attempting to teach, without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn, is hammering on a cold iron.
Education costs money, but then so does ignorance.
Education...is a painful, continual and difficult work to be done in kindness, by watching, by warning,... by praise, but above all -- by example.
Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
Education should turn out the pupil with something he knows well and something he can do well.
Getting things done is not always what is most important. There is value in allowing others to learn, even if the task is not accomplished as quickly, efficiently or effectively.
Give me a fish and I eat for a day. Teach me to fish and I eat for a lifetime.
Good teachers are those who know how little they know. Bad teachers are those who think they know more than they don't know.
Good teaching is more a giving of right questions than a giving of right answers.
I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.
If the child is not learning the way you are teaching, then you must teach in the way the child learns
If what you're doing isn't working, try something else!
I may have said the same thing before... but my explanation, I am sure, will always be different.
I put the relation of a fine teacher to a student just below the relation of a mother to a son.
It is important that students bring a certain ragamuffin, barefoot, irreverence to their studies; they are not here to worship what is known, but to question it.
quotes.quote_by: J. Bronowski, The Ascent of Man

quotes.quote: Learning is finding out what you already know. Doing is demonstrating that you know it. Teaching is reminding others that they know it just as well as you. You are all learners, doers, teachers
Men learn while they teach.
No matter how good teaching may be, each student must take the responsibility for his own education.
People's behavior makes sense if you think about it in terms of their goals, needs, and motives.
Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its values only to its scarcity.
Spoonfeeding, in the long run, teaches us nothing but the shape of the spoon
Teachers should guide without dictating, and participate without dominating.
Teach your children by what you are, not just by what you say.
The authority of those who teach is often an obstacle to those who want to learn.
The basic idea behind teaching is to teach people what they need to know.
The best teacher is the one who suggests rather than dogmatizes, and inspires his listener with the wish to teach himself.
The job of an educator is to teach students to see the vitality in themselves.
The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be ignited.
There are no difficult students - just students who don't want to do it your way.
The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
To define is to destroy, to suggest is to create.
To me the sole hope of human salvation lies in teaching.
To teach is to learn twice.
Try to present at least three options. One is no choice at all. Two creates a dilemma. With three you begin to have real choice and flexibility
We think too much about effective methods of teaching and not enough about effective methods of learning.
What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.
Who dares to teach must never cease to learn.
You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him find it within himself.
A human being is not attaining his full heights until he is educated.
The great end of education is to discipline rather than to furnish the mind; to train it to the use of its own powers rather than to fill it with the accumulation of others.
America is the best half-educated country in the world.
Donec id justo non metus auctor commodo ut quis enim. Mauris fringilla dolor vel condimentum imperdiet.
A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.
A teacher is one who makes himself progressively unnecessary.
A teacher who is attempting to teach, without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn, is hammering on a cold iron.
Education costs money, but then so does ignorance.
Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
Be so busy improving your self that you have no time to criticize others.
What we possess is temporary, but what we become is permanent.
Blaming your faults on your nature does not change the nature of your faults.
What is now in the past was once in the future.
They who give have all things; they who withhold have nothing.
Comfort is no test of truth. Truth is often far from being comfortable.
Yoga teaches us to cure what need not be endured and endure what cannot be cured.
Wherever you are is the entry point.
An ounce of practice is worth a thousand words.
The only people who see the whole picture are the ones who step out of the frame.
The more you see the good in them, the more you will establish good in yourself.
When you work, work as if everything depends on you. When you pray, pray as if everything depends on God.
And when all the wars are over, a butterfly will still be beautiful.
Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
A man cannot be exactly the way he wants to be and also dream of keeping his wife.
Your principle should be to see everything and say nothing. The world changes so rapidly that if you want to get on you cannot afford to align yourself with any person or point of view.
A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.
Everything in its own pace happens. The gardener may water with a hundred buckets; fruit arrives only in its season.
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Art is the truth delivered through the medium of beauty.
That’s what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
Could fulfillment ever be felt as deeply as loss?
Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.
Why can’t we control our anger? Because we love perfection. Make a little room for imperfection in our lives.
Justice is better than admiration.
Refusal to accept the flow of the world is the root of all misery.
Having a soft heart in a cruel world is a sign of courage, not weakness.
The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
Service that is rendered without joy helps neither the servant nor the served.
I measure the progress of a community by the degree of progress which women have achieved.
You can change friends, but not neighbours.

Real education enhances the dignity of a human being and increases his or her self-respect. If only the real sense of education could be realized by each individual and carried forward in every field of human activity, the world will be so much a better place to live in.
Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Ultimately, education in its real sense is the pursuit of truth. It is an endless journey through knowledge and enlightenment.
The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
If you fail, never give up because FAIL means 'First Attempt In Learning'.
Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.
The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
You are always a student, never a master. You have to keep moving forward.
Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
Education is the movement from darkness to light.
Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.
Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
If a man empties his purse into his head, no man can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
